channel.title: Multi NPC Area [Project Insanity] Rep++
channel.description:
I've created a multi area inside of player.java, but when I try to make it so two players can attack one NPC at the same time, it comes up with "This monster is already in combat."
How can I fix it so the NPC can be attack by two players at once?
Thanks,
Anthony

item.dc:creator: @Resent Resent
item.description:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:6, topic:433251”]boolean in;

player.java and npc.java[/quote]

Yeah I get that, but where am i supposed to coords in NPCHandler.java?..

item.title: Multi NPC Area [Project Insanity] Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Resent Resent
item.description:
@Resent wrote:

Here’s my inmulti snippet from NPCHandler.java:

if ((Server.playerHandler.players[j].underAttackBy <= 0 && Server.playerHandler.players[j].underAttackBy2 <= 0) || Server.playerHandler.players[j].inMulti()) if (Server.playerHandler.players[j].heightLevel == npcs[i].heightLevel) return j; } } } return 0; }

And here are the coordinates that I’m trying to add: (absX >= 2087 && absX <= 2107 && absY >= 4419 && absY <= 4438) ||

How can I add it so it recognizes it as a multi NPC area?..

Read full topic

item.title: Multi NPC Area [Project Insanity] Rep++
item.dc:creator: @voetbal645 voetbal645
item.description:
@voetbal645 wrote:

fir3 cap3:

Needs to be in an multi area

Dude wtf are u saying.
You can easy make from a non-multi area a multi-area just in 2 files.
player.java and npchandler.java

item.title: Multi NPC Area [Project Insanity] Rep++
item.dc:creator: @voetbal645 voetbal645
item.description:
@voetbal645 wrote:

in player.java it’s just for the icon.
U need to add it in npchandler.java to.
Search for inmulti or something and add the coords that you have added in player.java
hope it helped
